alert.note: Alert for Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 5:51AM CST until February 20 at 9:38AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall received yesterday continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Laclede. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 AM CST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, Meramec River at Spur Road, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Gladden Creek at County Road 624 and Big Creek at County Road 390. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking, Cabool, Winona and Birch Tree. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
